gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Index to U.S. Geological Survey Streamflow Gauging Stations: Indiana, 2008

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: STREAMFLOW_GAUGING_STATIONS_USGS_IN is a point shapefile intended for use as a layer in geographic information systems software. It shows the approximate locations of 179 streamflow gauges maintained by the United States Geological Survey (USGS) in Indiana. The gauges are part of a real-time national streamflow network.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The layer was created to provide locations of streamflow gauges in Indiana. The point attributes contain a link field allowing users to link from this layer to real-time streamflow data for each individual gauging station.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Data compiled by the Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS version 9.3 shapefile format, approximately 160 Kb

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: Locations were acquired by IGS personnel from the USGS Real-Time Water Data for Indiana Web site (http://waterdata.usgs.gov/in/nwis/rt).

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: No checks for logical consistency were made.
This layer includes one point for each streamflow gauging station maintained by the USGS in Indiana as of June 2008, as per the USGS Web site (http://waterdata.usgs.gov/in/nwis/rt).

All attributes values except "URL_link" were imported from electronic data downloaded from the USGS Web site (http://waterdata.usgs.gov/in/nwis/rt). Values in the "URL_Link" field were created using the Field Calculator tool in ArcMap. No manual data entry was performed. Attributes are as accurate as the data provided by USGS.
A spot check of several gauging station locations against the 2005 color orthophotography data set for Indiana indicated that most points are within 50 feet of the actual gauge locations.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: IGS personnel downloaded gauging station information for Indiana using the "Build Custom Table" function on the USGS Web site (http://waterdata.usgs.gov/in/nwis/rt). These data were copied to a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet and saved as IN_Gauging_Stations.xls. This table was then imported into ESRI ArcMap as an "event layer" using the Tools > Add XY data menu. It was then exported as a shapefile (in UTM NAD83 Zone 16 North coordinates) named STREAMFLOW_GAUGING_STATIONS_USGS_IN.shp. IGS personnel then used the Field Calculator in ArcMap to build the values for the "URL_Link" field.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit. v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
Locations, names, and ID numbers of streamflow gauging stations

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
